EROSION CONTROL
Erosion is something that may happen gradually or quickly depending on the terrain surrounding your home. Frequently the areas near the foundation should be checked to verify that any channeling or holes caused from heavy rainfall are filled. Where downspouts drain, be sure to keep splashblocks or similiar hard surface material in place to prevent deterioration of sod, grass or landscaping. Difficult to maintain areas on slopes or near retaining walls should also be inspected regularly during rainy seasons. Establishing long term erosion landscaping such as love grass, junipers or hardwood trees in these areas will prevent bigger issues later. If pinestraw was used on the construction of a new home, routine "freshening" up of these areas will also help displace water.
If your lawn was seeded, it is not uncommon to have slight erosion that displaces the seed.
Regular seed and straw may need to be done until the lawn is fully established. Most builder
warranty programs exclude damages caused by erosion. For this reason, extra effort is
required to verify that the new yard is maintained after heavy rainfall.
